not what codecs mplayer has, what codecs it lists for the file in question when run from the command line ie what decoders does it try to open?
when running mplayer from the terminal, there should be a bunch of output in that terminal, something like "Opening video decoder: [ffmpeg]  FFmpeg's libavcodec codec family" should be in that output
does the file play at all?  ie is the video blocky?
what version of ubuntu do you have?
what are you trying to remove?
In synaptic, you can click the search button and search for packages. ie in this case search for mplayer
In synaptic, then on the package listing you right click on the package and it gives you the option to "Mark for removal"
In synaptic, then click apply and it should remove it.  If it is a dependency of other installed packages it will warn you
are you using 2.0 or 1.5?
